name: aphetic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the gradual loss of an unstressed (= weak) vowel sound at the beginning of a word: In spoken English, many people do not pronounce the word "eleven" with three syllables, but use an aphetic variant that sounds like "leven". Aphetic forms and phonetic spelling are very common in this 16th century book.
More examplesFewer examplesDictionaries disagree on whether "maze" is an aphetic reduction of "amaze".The pronoun "it" was an aphetic form of the Old English pronoun "hit".The word "it's" is just an aphetic elision of "it is".
